metadata.Title: CVE-2021-45085 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
XSS can occur in GNOME Web (aka Epiphany) before 40.4 and 41.x before 41.1 via an about: page, as demonstrated by ephy-about:overview when a user visits an XSS payload page often enough to place that page on the Most Visited list.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-45085` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

epiphany-browser - 3.36.4-0ubuntu2
epiphany-browser-data - 3.36.4-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: epiphany-browser package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.36.4-0ubuntu2').
